title: A Serif to go with Akzidenz Grotesque?
content: I'm liking Akzidenz Grotesque these days. Wondering what suggestions you folks would have for a good solid serif to complement it.
author: mattmcclay

comments.content:
Old style or transitional with grotesque?  
That's like harp with saxophone--interesting contrast but a little offbeat.  
The classic combination for a late 19th century sans serif would be a [modern](http://web.archive.org/web/20130627073405/http:/www.shinntype.com/scotch.html) face.  
If by solid you mean chunky, then a Century or a Clarendon would be a good choice.
